intro: Pichonia grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered pichonia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its showy, bright yellow to orange flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are typically simple, opposite, and have a glossy texture. Pichonia grandiflora is often cultivated for its ornamental value in tropical gardens.
